description.narrative:
Nederländska institutet för flerpartidemokrati (NIMD) kommer att genomföra en nio månaders pilotfas för att främja ungas demokratiska deltagande i Guatemala. Under denna period kommer NIMD att ta fram nya innovativa metoder, genomföra studier och identifiera lokala partnerorganisationer. Arbetsprocessen kommer aktivt att involvera unga män och kvinnor och sätta deras perspektiv centrum. Särskilt fokus kommer att läggas på ungdomsgrupper som idag är särskilt exkluderade, framför allt unga på landsbygden som tillhör urfolksgrupper, unga kvinnor samt unga som identifierar sig som HBTQI.
Pilotfasen kommer även att stödja och stärka Medborgarkommissioner för transparens i åtta regioner. Kommissionerna, som etablerades under den avslutade Sida-insatsen med kongressen (PARLAD), arbetar för att främja ”social audit”, transparens och ansvarsutkrävande på lokal nivå, exempelvis genom att följa upp kommunbudgeten och genomförandet av kommunpolitiken.
I slutet av pilotfasen förväntas NIMD ha formulerat ett omfattande och integrerat program som kan skapa förutsättningar för fler unga att engagera sig för politisk, ekonomisk och social utveckling i sina samhällen.
NIMD är en aktör med omfattande nätverk i regionen, gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med demokratiskt deltagande och har under PARLAD-programmet inlett ett arbete med ungdomar som Sida nu vill bygga vidare på. Under pilotfasen får NIMD tid på sig att stärka sin lokala förankring genom nya partnerskap på landsbygden och att bygga upp tillräckligt med institutionell och administrativ kapacitet för att hantera mer komplexa program.
Sida bidrar med 3,5 miljoner kronor för att genomföra pilotfasen från april till december 2019. Genom Ambassaden i Guatemala för Sida en dialog om framtida samarbete med Nederländernas ambassad i Costa Rica, som ger rambidrag till NIMD via ett globalt stöd.

The Netherlands Institute for Multiparty Democracy has applied to Sida for funding of 3 500 000 SEK to carry out a nine month inception phase of Youth Democratic Participation program, during which NIMD will seek to identify new and innovative methodologies and approaches to promote youth democratic participation through participatory program design process. Special attention will be given to excluded youth groups, namely rural, indigenous youth, young women and LGBTIQ youth.
At the end of the inception phase, NIMD will have formulated a comprehensive and integral program desing to promote youth democratic participation in Guatemala, directed mainly to vulnerable and excluded youth groups in rural areas of Guatemala to create the necessary conditions for more young people to become positive actors of change for political, economic and social development in their communities. As part of the formulation process, NIMD will carry out a multidimensional poverty analysis, a document review, a mapping exercise, identify local partner organizations and prioritize geographical regions for future intervention.
Additionally, NIMD will take concrete measures to strengthen its institutional capacity, as laid out in the institutional capacity assessment funded by Sida in late 2018. Through external consultancies and hiring of new, in-house experts, NIMD will install methodologies, internal policies and information systems to guarantee efficient and effective technical, administrative and financial processes and procedures in order to successfully administer donor funds in the future.
The inception phase will also support and strengthen the eight already existing Provincial Citizen Commissions for Transparency which were established during PARLAD programme to perform social audit at municipal and local level, through training on issues related to access to information, migration, monitoring and evalation of municipal plans, among others. These Commissions provide presence for NIMD in the provinces and will support NIMD in the formulation of the new program desing.
NIMD has demonstrated good technical capacity to train organized civil society groups in issues relevant to democratic participation and has the capacity to link actors toward common goals, giving special emphasis on working with the youth and empowering women.
A maximum of 3 500 000 SEK will be made available for the inception phase through April to December 2019.

The overall objective of the preparatory project is to formulate, through participatory inception phase, a multi-annual program to promote youth democratic participation among underrepresented and marginalized youth groups through innovative methodologies, and to strengthen the Netherlands Institute for Multiparty Democracy (NIMD) Guatemala office institutional capacity, by improving internal control, establishing technical criteria, methodologies and pertinent information systems which allow efficient and effective coordination, administration, financial management and execution of donor funds.

description.narrative: NIMD Guatemala Executive Director established a working group to carry out project implementation. The working group included personnel from NIMD HQ in The Hague and local staff in Guatemala, who were supported by temporary consultants. During the eleven month inception phase, all expected results were achieved. Among the most important results are the following: Institutional strengthening - All processes related to audits, hiring and financial management were updated and strengthened - A coordinator was hired to direct and oversee implementation of institutional strengthening process. Guidelines were designed to create an internal audit department - Guidelines to create Human Resources department. External consultant with expertise in institutional manuals and procedures was hired to support the process - In order to minimize risks, methodology was designed to evaluate and select local partners for the multiannual programme - Methodology to evaluate personnel performance was designed - Anti-corruption and anti-fraud policy was created, and NIMD adhered to Central Bank's Special Verification protocol to prevent and detect money laundering - Institutional Gender policy was formulated - Institutional communication strategy was designed - NIMD information systems were redesigned and updated to allow follow-up and documentation related to internal and external M&E; operative planning for each project under execution; and with links to financial execution and reporting. The system still needs perfection and hiring of information systems expert has been recommended by external audit - budget tracking tool was designed to support efficient financial management of project funds and execution, including financial reporting to donor - a second institutional capacity audit was carried out at the end of the inception phase to determine level of compliance with capacity audit recommendations with positive results Program formulation In relation to participatory formulation of the new youth democratic participation program, NIMD carried out mapping exercise and consultations with youth and other key actors in six provinces out of which three were selected to participate in the program, in addition to Guatemala City. Workshops and interviews were conducted to obtain youth perspective on priority issues of interest related to democratic participation to be included in the new programme and to identify training and capacity building needs requested by youth representatives. Based on consultations, a general programme objective was defined together with three specific objectives, responding to input from the wide consultation process. Based on the work and results of the inception phase, Sida approved NIMD proposal for new youth democratic participation program (Jovenes +D) for the period of 2020-2023 in the amount of 39 500 000 SEK.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
